snippet: After the terrorist attack in France, President François Hollande and the far-right leader Marine Le Pen have seen a boost in popularity, but no one expects the praise to last very long.
abstract: French Pres Francois Hollande has received political boost amid his handling of terrorist attacks in Paris, garnering uncharacteristic praise for his calm demeanor and decisive action; incident has also boosted the fortunes of Marine Le Pen and his far-right National Front, which has made opposition to radical Islam a centerpiece of its platform; mood of solidarity is not expected to last long.
lead_paragraph: After the terrorist attack in France, President François Hollande and the far-right leader Marine Le Pen have seen a boost in popularity, but no one expects the praise to last very long.

headline.main: In Cold Political Terms, Far Right and French President Both Gain
headline.print_headline: In Cold Political Terms, Far Right and French President Both Gain
